intro: Adenocalymma stridula, commonly known as the stridulous adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
